intro: Aethionema clandestinum, commonly known as the Armenian carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a low-growing perennial that produces vibrant pink or white flowers in early summer. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its arid habitat. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. Aethionema clandestinum is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive blooms and compact growth habit.
